column1: The COVID-19 pandemic in Cuba is part of the worldwide pandemic of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2). The virus was confirmed to have spread to Cuba on 11 March 2020 when three Italian tourists tested positive for the virus.

column2: the World Health Organization (WHO) confirmed that a novel coronavirus was the cause of a respiratory illness in a cluster of people in Wuhan City
column5: which was reported to the WHO on 31 December 2019.The case fatality ratio for COVID-19 has been much lower than SARS of 2003
column6: but the transmission has been significantly greater
column7: with a significant total death toll.Cuba is a country that has sent medical personnel to other parts of the world during recent decades. In 2014 the WHO supported the deployment of medical personnel from Cuba to Africa to fight the Ebola epidemic. Cuba's “medical internationalism” has played an important role in the COVID-19 crisis. Cuba has sent medical personnel to the hardest-hit Italian wealthy region of Lombardy and Angola and a dozen Caribbean states including Suriname. However
column8: Cuba is also facing challenges on a domestic level. First of all
column9: it has a precarious domestic health system that is no longer what it used to be. Health professionals are facing challenges
column10: such as shortage of medical supply
column11: poor sanitary conditions and low wages. Cuba also has one of the oldest populations in the continent
column12: together with Uruguay. With one-quarter of the population being considered part of the population at-risk
column13: the poor health system might lead to a high death toll during the pandemic. In addition
column14: Cuba's economy has been precarious for the last two years. It is threatened by a deeper deterioration of the economic situation due to the decrease in tourism and by remittances [explain?]. As a consequence
column15: the government began centralizing economic decision-making in order to avoid a deeper economic crisis like the one experienced by the country after the end of the Cold War.

column2: the first three cases in Cuba were confirmed. The patients were Italian tourists. They were kept in isolation at the Pedro Kouri Tropical Medicine Institute in Havana.The government urged citizens to make their own face masks
column3: while the textile industry was drafted to fabricate them. People were advised to carry several cloth face masks with them
column4: depending on how many hours they plan to spend in public areas.On 12 March

column6: whose wife had arrived from Milan
